cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap. This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 2025-04-29.

heatwave.status: No active heatwave is observed currently. The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Record amounts of rain fell over 7.9 hours today with a total accumulation of 13.04mm.  It fell at 8.6 mm per hour at times and ranked 8th from our records.  27.64mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 15.9 hour precipitation event.  At times precipitation was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate climaxed at 27.0mm per hour today (ranking 0th from our records), resulting in 7.99mm of total rain in 2.0 hours.  The most severe rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 03 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  7.99mm fell during the storm over 2.0 hours.

storm.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 23 November 2024, the storm lasted 23.2 hours with a total precipitation of 24.56mm reaching 6.4mm per hour at times.
Active storm detected in the vicinity. This is the earliest storm we've experienced since September 03, 2025.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting August 26, 2025, is ranked 4th among the longest rainy periods since August 2024. It has lasted 9 days consecutively so far.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was July 18, 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (213°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 Oct 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 Oct 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 79.56 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 Oct 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.8°C) and outside temperature (up 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.5 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1702 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 115.7m lower than yesterday, 598.9m lower than the past week, 1702.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 713m to a maximum of 1594m, averaging 951.2m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1550.1m and 2650m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, you’ll experience intense stickiness in the air and calm and still conditions are expected. Light to moderate rain is forecast, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and a mix of sun and clouds. Weather could become unsettled.
